name: Scientific Evidence Provenance
description: Investigates scientific evidence using GRADE framework logic and Cochrane RoB 2 bias assessment. Study type determines the assessment pathway. Funding investigation is mandatory.

task.purpose: Find the actual published paper for evidence "{evidence.description}" and extract core metadata. Without locating the original study, all downstream assessment is based on potentially distorted secondary reporting.
keyTasks: Find the actual published paper. Extract: study type (RCT, cohort, case-control, cross-sectional, case report, meta-analysis, systematic review), sample size, journal name, publication year, DOI/PMID.
Verify the paper has not been retracted by checking Retraction Watch and PubMed retraction notices.
If a DOI or PMID is available, confirm it resolves to the correct paper.
Record the journal's impact factor and check if it appears on predatory journal lists.
task.endState: Original study located with study type classified, core metadata extracted (DOI, PMID, journal, sample size, impact factor), and retraction status confirmed.

requiredOutputs.description: Type of study: rct, crossover-rct, cohort, case-control, cross-sectional, case-report, case-series, animal, in-vitro, meta-analysis, systematic-review
Whether the study has been retracted

task.purpose: Assess bias in "{parent.findings.studyTitle}" ({parent.doi}). The study type is "{parent.studyType}" which determines the assessment framework: RoB 2 for RCTs, ROBINS-I for observational studies, AMSTAR-2 for reviews, or low-hierarchy assessment for case reports/animal/in-vitro.
keyTasks: For RCTs: Assess five RoB 2 bias domains — (1) randomization process, (2) deviations from intended intervention, (3) missing outcome data, (4) outcome measurement, (5) selective reporting. Check trial registration against published outcomes.

For observational studies: Assess seven ROBINS-I bias domains — (1) confounding, (2) participant selection, (3) intervention classification, (4) deviations, (5) missing data, (6) outcome measurement, (7) selective reporting. Identify critical confounders.

For systematic reviews/meta-analyses: Assess review methodology — search comprehensiveness, inclusion criteria appropriateness, bias assessment performed, heterogeneity addressed. Apply AMSTAR-2 if applicable.
For case reports/animal/in-vitro: Document inherent limitations (N=1, no control, translation uncertainty). Search for higher-quality evidence on the same question.
task.endState: Bias assessment completed with per-domain ratings and overall bias classification. For low-hierarchy evidence, higher-quality evidence search completed.

requiredOutputs.description: Overall bias rating: low, some-concerns, high
Framework used: rob2, robins-i, amstar2, low-hierarchy
Whether trial registration matches published outcomes (RCTs)
Overall quality for reviews: high, moderate, low, critically-low
Whether higher-quality evidence exists on the same question
Conclusion from higher-quality evidence if found

task.purpose: Investigate who funded "{parent.findings.studyTitle}" ({parent.doi}) and whether the funding source has financial interests that could bias results. Industry-funded studies show a systematic pattern of favorable outcomes per meta-epidemiological evidence.
keyTasks: Identify who funded the study from the paper's disclosure section. If no disclosure section exists, search for the corresponding author's grants and industry relationships.

For each funder: determine if they are independent (government grant agency, private foundation with no commercial interest), industry (company that sells a product related to the study), or undisclosed.
For industry funders: search for other studies they have funded. Check if there is a pattern of results favoring their products.
Check author financial disclosures. Search Open Payments database for U.S.-based authors. For non-U.S. authors, check the journal's conflict-of-interest disclosures.
task.endState: Funding source identified and classified, author conflicts documented, and funding bias pattern assessed.

requiredOutputs.description: Funder classification: independent, industry, government, undisclosed
Whether financial conflicts of interest were found

task.purpose: Determine whether "{parent.findings.studyTitle}" has been replicated, contradicted, or superseded. A single study — regardless of quality — provides limited confidence without replication.
keyTasks: Search for replication studies that attempted to reproduce the findings.
Search for contradicting evidence — studies that reached opposite conclusions on the same question.
Search for meta-analyses that include this study. Note the meta-analytic conclusion.
Check if the findings have been superseded by newer research.
task.endState: Replication landscape mapped: replications found/not found, contradictory evidence cataloged, meta-analytic context established, and supersession status determined.

requiredOutputs.description: Whether replications confirm the original findings
Whether a meta-analysis including this study exists
Whether findings have been superseded by newer research
